data.title: 20x Best Museums in Paris (France)
data.meta_description: Top 20 Best Museums in Paris France âï¸ Overview of the most beautiful Paris museums âï¸ Louvre Museum âï¸ MusÃ©e d'Orsay
data.text:
1. MusÃ©e du Louvre

The magnificent Louvre Museum is one of the largest museums in the world. This museum is absolutely stunning! The Louvre Museum is situated in an historic city palace and houses an enormous collection of exquisite artwork. The best-known pieces in the collection are 'The Mona Lisa by Da Vinci' and the beautiful marble sculpture 'Venus de Milo'. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e du Louvre

2. MusÃ©e dâOrsay

Beautiful MusÃ©e dâOrsay is housed in a former 19th century station hall. The collection consists mainly of Impressionist artwork. In the museum, you can see paintings by Gauguin, Monet, Renoir, and Van Gogh. Almost all the pieces in MusÃ©e dâOrsay were created between 1848 and 1914. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e dâOrsay

3. Centre Pompidou

Centre George Pompidou is a one-of-a-kind landmark in Paris. This bright-colored structure sticks out with lots of tubes and stairs on the outside. The Centre Pompidou is a well-known institution that has an enormous collection of modern art. There are around 50,000 objects on display in museum. Click here for additional information about Centre Pompidou

The building of Centre Pompidou needs to be renovated. As a result, the museum will be closed for at least four years, starting at the end of 2025.

4. MusÃ©e de lâOrangerie

MusÃ©e de l'Orangerie is located in the beautiful gardens of the Louvre Museum. This lovely museum contains artwork from the 19th and 20th centuries. The museumâs collection includes artwork by Monet, Picasso, Renoir, and Rodin. The bright paintings 'The Water Lilies by Monet' are the highlights of the museum. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e de lâOrangerie

7. MusÃ©e Carnavalet

MusÃ©e Carnavalet is one of the oldest museums in Paris. The beautiful museum focuses on the history of Paris and is located in the district of Le Marais. The museumâs collection is divided into more than 100 small rooms. The highlights of the museum are 30 completely furnished historical chambers from the 18th century. The museumâs permanent collection is free to visit. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e Carnavalet

8. MusÃ©e Picasso

The Picasso Museum in Paris is housed in a historic hotel from the 17th century and is located in the district of Le Marais. The lovely museum houses 5,000 artworks by the renowned Spanish artist Pablo Picasso. The earliest item in the museum is a self-portrait from 1901. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e Picasso

11. MusÃ©e GrÃ©vin

MusÃ©e GrÃ©vin is the wax museum of Paris and has been around since 1882. The museum is named after Alfred GrÃ©vin, a well-known French cartoonist and costume designer. The French museum has over 200 wax figures of national and international celebrities. Among those are statues of Edith Piaf, Brad Pitt, George Clooney, and Kathy Perry. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e GrÃ©vin

12. CitÃ© des sciences et de l'industrie

CitÃ© des Sciences et de l'Industrie is Paris' main scientific museum. The massive, five-story museum has been around since 1986. It is the largest science and engineering museum in all of Europe. The highlights of the museum are a beautiful planetarium and a real submarine. Click here for additional information about CitÃ© des Sciences et de lâIndustrie

15. MusÃ©e Grande Galerie de lâÃvolution

MusÃ©e Grande Galerie de l'Ãvolution shows how the plant and animal kingdoms have evolved through the years. The museum houses a large variety of animal species. Most of them are African savannah and marine animals. The museum is located close to Jardin des Plantes, a beautiful botanical public park in Paris. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e Grande Galerie de lâÃvolution

16. MusÃ©e Jacquemart

MusÃ©e Jacquemart houses the private collection of billionaire Edouard AndrÃ©. He was a great admirer of antique Italian artwork. The museumâs collection is extensive and covers 187 rooms. Several paintings by the well-known Italian painter Botticelli can be found in the museum. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e Jacquemart

MusÃ©e Jacquemart needs to be renovated. As a result, the museum will be closed till September 2024.

18. MusÃ©e des Plans-Reliefs

MusÃ©e des Plans-Reliefs houses a large collection of war attributes from the time of Napoleon Bonaparte. There are numerous historical battle outfits and weaponry on display. The top floor of the museum includes a large collection of three-dimensional replicas of 18th century cities. The models are the originals from that time and were used during war battles. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e des Plans-Reliefs

20. MusÃ©e de Montmartre

Charming MusÃ©e de Montmartre is located in the 18th district of Paris. The museums illustrate the history of the beloved area of Montmartre. The collection of the museum includes graphics, posters, and paintings. It is also possible to enjoy the peaceful garden of the museum. Click here for additional information about MusÃ©e de Montmartre
